gnat.utils
Class FileHelper

java.lang.Object
  gnat.utils.FileHelper

public class FileHelper
extends java.lang.Object

Provides different static methods to handle in- and output from and to files.

Author:
Joerg Hakenberg

Field Detail

onlyFilenamesFilter

static java.io.FilenameFilter onlyFilenamesFilter
This file filter accepts only normal files, e.g. no directories. See java.io.File.isFile().

onlyFilenamesFilterWithExpression

static java.io.FilenameFilter onlyFilenamesFilterWithExpression
This file filter accepts only normal files that additionally match a file filter expression. Get and set the current file filter expression with (g|s)etFilefilterExpression. Default: ".*"

onlyDirectorynamesFilter

static java.io.FilenameFilter onlyDirectorynamesFilter
This file filter accepts only directories. See java.io.File.isDirectory().

filefilterExpression

private static java.lang.String filefilterExpression

getFilenamesFromDirectory

public static java.lang.String[] getFilenamesFromDirectory(java.lang.String dirname)
Returns the names of all files found in the specified directory

Parameters:
dirname -
Returns:
String[]

getFilenamesFromDirectory

public static java.lang.String[] getFilenamesFromDirectory(java.lang.String dirname,
                                                           boolean recursively)
Returns the names of all files found in the specified directory. If recursively is true, returns files in subdirectories as well. Uses the current setting for the file filter expression (change/get it using the methods setFilefilterExpression(String) and getFilefilterExpression()), and returns file names fitting this expression only (no directories etc.).

Parameters:
dirname -
recursively -
Returns:
String[]

getFilenamesFromDirectory

public static java.lang.String[] getFilenamesFromDirectory(java.lang.String dirname,
                                                           boolean recursively,
                                                           java.lang.String expression)
Returns the names of all files found in the specified directory and matching the given expression. If recursively is true, returns files in subdirectories as well.

Parameters:
dirname -
recursively -
expression -
Returns:
String[]

setFilefilterExpression

public static void setFilefilterExpression(java.lang.String exp)
Sets a new value for the default file filter expression.
Default is ".*"

Parameters:
exp -
